org.jamsim.ascape.r
Class ScapeRInterface

java.lang.Object
  org.jamsim.ascape.r.ScapeRInterface

public class ScapeRInterface
extends Object

Exposes scape specific R functionality for a particular scape, as well as general R functionality.

Version:
$Revision$
Author:
Oliver Mannion

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

ScapeRInterface

public ScapeRInterface(RLoader rLoader,
                       MicroSimScape<?> msScape,
                       String dataFrameSymbol,
                       boolean keepAllRunDFs)
Constructor.

Parameters:
rLoader - R loader
msScape - micro simulation scape
dataFrameSymbol - replacement symbol. When evaluating commands that reference the scape dataframe, this symbol is searched for and replaced with the current run's dataframe name.
keepAllRunDFs - flag to keep the dataframes from each run in R. This means creating each new dataframe with a unique name.

public String rcmdReplace(String rcmd,
                          int run)

Parameters:
rcmd - R command containing text to replace

dataframe name

assignDataFrame

public void assignDataFrame(String name,
                            Collection<?> col,
                            Class<?> stopClass)
                     throws RInterfaceException
Create a dataframe in R from the given collection. Introspection is used to determine the bean properties (i.e.: getter methods) that are exposed, and each one becomes a column in the dataframe. Columns are only created for primitive properties and arrays of primitive properties; object properties are ignored without warning. NB: doesn't automatically create factors like read.table does.

Parameters:
name - the name of the dataframe to create in R.
col - the Java collection to convert.
stopClass - Columns are created for all getter methods that are defined by stopClass's subclasses. stopClass's getter methods and superclass getter methods are not converted to columns in the dataframe.
Throws:
RInterfaceException - if Collection cannot be read, or dataframe cannot be created.

assignDataFrame

public void assignDataFrame(String name,
                            net.casper.data.model.CDataCacheContainer container)
                     throws RInterfaceException
Create a dataframe in R from the given casper dataset. NB: doesn't automatically create factors like read.table does.

Parameters:
name - the name of the dataframe to create in R.
container - the casper container to convert.
Throws:
RInterfaceException - if Collection cannot be read, or dataframe cannot be created.

eval

public org.rosuda.REngine.REXP eval(String expr)
                             throws RInterfaceException
Evaluate a String expression in R in the global environment. See RInterfaceHL.eval(String).

Parameters:
expr - expression to evaluate.
Returns:
REXP result of the evaluation.
Throws:
RInterfaceException - if problem during parse or evaluation. Parse errors will simply return the message "parse error".

parseEvalPrint

public org.rosuda.REngine.REXP parseEvalPrint(String expr)
Evaluate an expression printing to the console any errors (including syntactic) and the expression if it is visible. See RInterfaceHL.parseEvalPrint(String).

Parameters:
expr - expression to evaluate
Returns:
evaluated result

parseEvalTry

public org.rosuda.REngine.REXP parseEvalTry(String expr)
                                     throws RInterfaceException
Wraps a parse and try around an eval. The parse will generate syntax error messages, and the try will catch parse and evaluation errors and return them in the exception as opposed to printing it on the console.

Parameters:
expr - expression to try and parse and eval
Returns:
REXP result of the evaluation.
Throws:
RInterfaceException - if there is a parse or evaluation error the error message is returned in the exception. Nothing printed to the console.

help

public void help(String expr)
Display R help for given expression.

Parameters:
expr - expression. If "" displays help contents

linefeed

public void linefeed()
Print linefeed to console.

printPrompt

public final void printPrompt()
Print the prompt to the console.

evalCaptureOutput

public String evalCaptureOutput(String expr)
                         throws RInterfaceException
Evaluate a String expression in R in the global environment. Returns all console output produced by this evaluation. Does not return the REXP produced by the evaluation. This is needed for functions like str which print their output and don't return anything.

Parameters:
expr - expression to evaluate.
Returns:
console output from the evaluation.
Throws:
RInterfaceException - if problem during parse or evaluation. Parse errors will simply return the message "parse error".

evalReturnString

public String[] evalReturnString(String expr)
Evaluate expression returning a String array. See RInterfaceHL.evalReturnString(String).

Parameters:
expr - expression to evaluate.
Returns:
REXP result of the evaluation.

printlnToConsole

public void printlnToConsole(String msg)
Print a message out to the R console with a line feed.

Parameters:
msg - message to print.

loadPackage

public final void loadPackage(String pack)
                       throws RInterfaceException
Loads a package. If it isn't installed, it is loaded from CRAN.

Parameters:
pack - package name
Throws:
RInterfaceException - if problem loading package.
